classes.title: SOWO89.
classes.subtitle: First-Year Seminar: Special Topics.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Special topics course. Content will vary each semester.Repeat rules: May be repeated for credit; may be repeated in the same term for different topics; 6 total credits. 2 total completions.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: SOWO403
classes.subtitle: Social Work Study Abroad.  1-6 Credits.
classes.description: Special topics course. Content will vary each semester.Repeat rules: May be repeated for credit; may be repeated in the same term for different topics; 6 total credits. 2 total completions.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: SOWO403
classes.subtitle: Social Work Study Abroad.  1-6 Credits.
classes.description: Variable content.  Course examines international social issues, programs, and policies and their impact on client populations and cultures in a particular country or global region.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: SOWO404
classes.subtitle: Social Work Study Abroad: Africa.  1-6 Credits.
classes.description: Variable content.  Course examines international social issues, programs, and policies and their impact on client populations and cultures in a particular country or global region.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: SOWO404
classes.subtitle: Social Work Study Abroad: Africa.  1-6 Credits.
classes.description: Course examines social issues, development strategies, health/mental health programs. Explores how country's fledgling democracy and people are redesigning organizations and interventions to respond to the needs of South Africans.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: SOWO489
classes.subtitle: Public Service and Social Change.  4 Credits.
classes.description: Course examines social issues, development strategies, health/mental health programs. Explores how country's fledgling democracy and people are redesigning organizations and interventions to respond to the needs of South Africans.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: SOWO489
classes.subtitle: Public Service and Social Change.  4 Credits.
classes.description: Course examines the role of volunteer involvement and citizen participation in community development, grassroots organizing, advocacy, and other efforts to create a more just and democratic society. Includes a service-learning requirement.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: SOWO490
classes.subtitle: Preprofessional Special Topic.  1-6 Credits.
classes.description: Course examines the role of volunteer involvement and citizen participation in community development, grassroots organizing, advocacy, and other efforts to create a more just and democratic society. Includes a service-learning requirement.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: SOWO490
classes.subtitle: Preprofessional Special Topic.  1-6 Credits.
classes.description: Focuses on current professional social work issues. The focus will be specified each time the course is offered.Repeat rules: May be repeated for credit; may be repeated in the same term for different topics; 6 total credits. 6 total completions.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: SOWO491
classes.subtitle: Community Organizing for Social Change.  4 Credits.
classes.description: Focuses on current professional social work issues. The focus will be specified each time the course is offered.Repeat rules: May be repeated for credit; may be repeated in the same term for different topics; 6 total credits. 6 total completions.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: SOWO491
classes.subtitle: Community Organizing for Social Change.  4 Credits.
classes.description: Course examines different types of advocacy strategies and their use in efforts both to enhance the delivery of services to disadvantaged populations and to promote social change in communities.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: SOWO492
classes.subtitle: Seminar in Service Learning.  1-6 Credits.
classes.description: Course examines different types of advocacy strategies and their use in efforts both to enhance the delivery of services to disadvantaged populations and to promote social change in communities.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: SOWO492
classes.subtitle: Seminar in Service Learning.  1-6 Credits.
classes.description: Participants explore frameworks, values, and skills around the democratic principles of service, citizenship, and social justice. Accompanies an intensive, paid internship in a local nonprofit agency.Gen Ed: EE- Service Learning.Repeat rules: May be repeated for credit. 6 total credits. 6 total completions.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: SOWO495
classes.subtitle: Undergraduate Research in Social Work.  1-6 Credits.
classes.description: Participants explore frameworks, values, and skills around the democratic principles of service, citizenship, and social justice. Accompanies an intensive, paid internship in a local nonprofit agency.Gen Ed: EE- Service Learning.Repeat rules: May be repeated for credit. 6 total credits. 6 total completions.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: SOWO495
classes.subtitle: Undergraduate Research in Social Work.  1-6 Credits.
classes.description: Research under the supervision of a selected instructor. Approved learning contract required.Requisites: Prerequisite, Permission of the instructor and school.Repeat rules: May be repeated for credit; may be repeated in the same term for different topics; 12 total credits. 12 total completions.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: SOWO500
classes.subtitle: Human Development in Context I: Infancy to Adolescence.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Research under the supervision of a selected instructor. Approved learning contract required.Requisites: Prerequisite, Permission of the instructor and school.Repeat rules: May be repeated for credit; may be repeated in the same term for different topics; 12 total credits. 12 total completions.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: SOWO500
classes.subtitle: Human Development in Context I: Infancy to Adolescence.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Course provides an overview of child and adolescent development in an environmental context, surveying major theoretical frameworks and highlighting the impact of different factors on individual development, functioning and health.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: SOWO501
classes.subtitle: Confronting Oppression and Institutional Discrimination.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Course provides an overview of child and adolescent development in an environmental context, surveying major theoretical frameworks and highlighting the impact of different factors on individual development, functioning and health.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: SOWO501
classes.subtitle: Confronting Oppression and Institutional Discrimination.  3 Credits.
classes.description: This course examines institutionalized oppression and its implications for social work practice at all levels, emphasizing the consequences of social inequality and the social worker's responsibilities to fight oppression.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: SOWO505
classes.subtitle: Human Development in Context II: Adulthood.  3 Credits.
classes.description: This course examines institutionalized oppression and its implications for social work practice at all levels, emphasizing the consequences of social inequality and the social worker's responsibilities to fight oppression.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: SOWO505
classes.subtitle: Human Development in Context II: Adulthood.  3 Credits.
classes.description: This course reviews typical and divergent adult development in context, surveys major theoretical frameworks, and highlights the impact of social injustices on adult development.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: SOWO510
classes.subtitle: Foundations for Evidence-Based Practice and Program Evaluation.  3 Credits.
classes.description: This course reviews typical and divergent adult development in context, surveys major theoretical frameworks, and highlights the impact of social injustices on adult development.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: SOWO510
classes.subtitle: Foundations for Evidence-Based Practice and Program Evaluation.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Develop knowledge of evidence-based practice, including skills needed to acquire and assess appropriate interventions for practice and skills required to evaluate social work practice.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: SOWO520
classes.subtitle: Social Work Practicum I.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Develop knowledge of evidence-based practice, including skills needed to acquire and assess appropriate interventions for practice and skills required to evaluate social work practice.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: SOWO520
classes.subtitle: Social Work Practicum I.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Students learn beginning practice skills through experimental opportunities and apply core knowledge to direct (individuals, families, groups) and macro (organizations, communities) social work practice two days per week in an agency setting. (Field fee: $300.)Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: SOWO521
classes.subtitle: Social Work Practicum II.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Students learn beginning practice skills through experimental opportunities and apply core knowledge to direct (individuals, families, groups) and macro (organizations, communities) social work practice two days per week in an agency setting. (Field fee: $300.)Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: SOWO521
classes.subtitle: Social Work Practicum II.  3 Credits.
classes.description: A continuation of SOWO�520, providing opportunities for students to demonstrate increased ability to assess, plan, administer, and evaluate appropriate social work practice interventions. (Field fee: $300.)Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: SOWO522
classes.subtitle: Pre-Concentration Practicum for Advanced Standing Students.  4 Credits.
classes.description: A continuation of SOWO�520, providing opportunities for students to demonstrate increased ability to assess, plan, administer, and evaluate appropriate social work practice interventions. (Field fee: $300.)Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: SOWO522
classes.subtitle: Pre-Concentration Practicum for Advanced Standing Students.  4 Credits.
classes.description: Course designed to assist students in summer classroom learning with direct experience in specialized field of practices. Serves to bridge the B.A.S.W. practicum with advanced concentration practicum. (Field fee: $300.)Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: SOWO523
classes.subtitle: Foundation Field Seminar I.  1 Credit.

classes.title: SOWO523
classes.subtitle: Foundation Field Seminar I.  1 Credit.
classes.description: Course is designed to assist students in integrating and applying classroom learning with the direct experience of the foundation field practicum. Opportunities are provided for discussion, support, and skills practice.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: SOWO524
classes.subtitle: Foundation Field Seminar II.  1 Credit.
classes.description: Course is designed to assist students in integrating and applying classroom learning with the direct experience of the foundation field practicum. Opportunities are provided for discussion, support, and skills practice.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: SOWO524
classes.subtitle: Foundation Field Seminar II.  1 Credit.
classes.description: Course is designed to assist students in integrating and applying classroom learning with the direct experience of the foundation field practicum. Opportunities are provided for discussion, support, and skills practice.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: SOWO530
classes.subtitle: Foundations of Social Welfare and Social Work.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Course is designed to assist students in integrating and applying classroom learning with the direct experience of the foundation field practicum. Opportunities are provided for discussion, support, and skills practice.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: SOWO530
classes.subtitle: Foundations of Social Welfare and Social Work.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Introduces public welfare policy through lecture and discussion of the purposes public welfare serves; describes the most important programs created by those policies.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: SOWO540

classes.title: SOWO570
classes.subtitle: Social Work Practice with Organizations and Communities.  3 Credits.

classes.subtitle: Social Work Practice with Organizations and Communities.  3 Credits.

classes.title: SOWO772
classes.subtitle: Social Work Practice.  1.5 Credit.
classes.description: Course is a brief overview of direct and macro practice social work. First half will focus on fundamentals of direct practice with individuals, families and groups and review assessment, diagnosis, treatment planning and intervention selection. Second half will review the fundamentals of macro social work practice. Including exposure to methods that groups, organizations and communities utilize to assess communities and address needs of individuals and families, and the impact of interagency functioning on service delivery.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: SOWO915
classes.subtitle: Research Practicum II.  1-6 Credits.
classes.description: Continuation of Research Practicum I.Repeat rules: May be repeated for credit. Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: SOWO916
classes.subtitle: Structural Equation Modeling.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Continuation of Research Practicum I.Repeat rules: May be repeated for credit. Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: SOWO916
classes.subtitle: Structural Equation Modeling.  3 Credits.
classes.description: In this course, students will learn fundamental concepts and skills to conduct structural equation modeling and will learn how to apply these techniques to social work research.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: SOWO917
classes.subtitle: Longitudinal and Multilevel Analysis.  3 Credits.
classes.description: In this course, students will learn fundamental concepts and skills to conduct structural equation modeling and will learn how to apply these techniques to social work research.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: SOWO917
classes.subtitle: Longitudinal and Multilevel Analysis.  3 Credits.
classes.description: This course introduces statistical frameworks, analytical tools, and social behavioral applications of three types of models: event history analysis, hierarchical linear modeling (HLM), and growth curve analysis.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: SOWO918
classes.subtitle: Applied Regression Analysis and Generalized Linear Models.  3 Credits.
classes.description: This course introduces statistical frameworks, analytical tools, and social behavioral applications of three types of models: event history analysis, hierarchical linear modeling (HLM), and growth curve analysis.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: SOWO918
classes.subtitle: Applied Regression Analysis and Generalized Linear Models.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Permission of the instructor. This course introduces statistical frameworks, analytical tools, and social behavioral applications of OLS regression model, weighted least-square regression, logistic regression models, and generalized linear models.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: SOWO919
classes.subtitle: Special Topics in Doctoral Research.  1-6 Credits.
classes.description: Permission of the instructor. This course introduces statistical frameworks, analytical tools, and social behavioral applications of OLS regression model, weighted least-square regression, logistic regression models, and generalized linear models.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: SOWO919
classes.subtitle: Special Topics in Doctoral Research.  1-6 Credits.
classes.description: Permission of the instructor. Topic determined by instructor and announced in advance.Repeat rules: May be repeated for credit; may be repeated in the same term for different topics.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: SOWO920
classes.subtitle: Special Topics in Social Work Doctoral Studies.  1-6 Credits.
classes.description: Permission of the instructor. Topic determined by instructor and announced in advance.Repeat rules: May be repeated for credit; may be repeated in the same term for different topics.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: SOWO920
classes.subtitle: Special Topics in Social Work Doctoral Studies.  1-6 Credits.
classes.description: Permission of the instructor. Topic determined by the instructor and announced in advance.Repeat rules: May be repeated for credit; may be repeated in the same term for different topics.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: SOWO921
classes.subtitle: Qualitative Research Methods.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Permission of the instructor. Topic determined by the instructor and announced in advance.Repeat rules: May be repeated for credit; may be repeated in the same term for different topics.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: SOWO921
classes.subtitle: Qualitative Research Methods.  3 Credits.
classes.description: This course will introduce the application of qualitative research methods for social work research.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: SOWO922
classes.subtitle: Advanced Topics in Causal Inference: Propensity Score and Related Models.  3 Credits.
classes.description: This course will introduce the application of qualitative research methods for social work research.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: SOWO922
classes.subtitle: Advanced Topics in Causal Inference: Propensity Score and Related Models.  3 Credits.
classes.description: This course focuses on advanced topics in causal inference by reviewing four recent methods developed for observational studies and evaluation of quasi-experimental programs.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: SOWO923
classes.subtitle: Systemic Reviews and Introduction to Meta-Analysis.  3 Credits.
classes.description: This course focuses on advanced topics in causal inference by reviewing four recent methods developed for observational studies and evaluation of quasi-experimental programs.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: SOWO923
classes.subtitle: Systemic Reviews and Introduction to Meta-Analysis.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Students will learn cutting-edge methods of research synthesis and will prepare and submit a systematic review to a peer reviewed professional journal before the semester ends.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: SOWO940
classes.subtitle: Development of Social Intervention Models.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Students will learn cutting-edge methods of research synthesis and will prepare and submit a systematic review to a peer reviewed professional journal before the semester ends.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: SOWO940
classes.subtitle: Development of Social Intervention Models.  3 Credits.
classes.description: A systematic approach to the design, implementation, and evaluation of social interventions provides the framework for developing models that address a range of social issues and needs.Requisites: Prerequisite, SOWO�900.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: SOWO941
classes.subtitle: Teaching Practicum.  3 Credits.
classes.description: A systematic approach to the design, implementation, and evaluation of social interventions provides the framework for developing models that address a range of social issues and needs.Requisites: Prerequisite, SOWO�900.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: SOWO941
classes.subtitle: Teaching Practicum.  3 Credits.
classes.description: This practicum provides a range of supervised classroom or training opportunities designed to prepare advanced doctoral students for faculty positions in undergraduate- and graduate-level social work education.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: SOWO994
classes.subtitle: Doctoral Research and Dissertation.  3 Credits.
classes.description: This practicum provides a range of supervised classroom or training opportunities designed to prepare advanced doctoral students for faculty positions in undergraduate- and graduate-level social work education.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: SOWO994
classes.subtitle: Doctoral Research and Dissertation.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Dissertation work.Repeat rules: May be repeated for credit.
